newsitem.title: USA: Ohio lawmaker proposes $2.5 bln bonds for schools.
newsitem.headline: Ohio lawmaker proposes $2.5 bln bonds for schools.

text.p: An Ohio lawmaker has proposed a five-year, $2.5 billion bonding plan for school construction and renovation.
State Rep. Jack Cera, D-Dellaire, said he planned to introduce a bill soon in the legislature that would allow the state to issue general obligation bonds for schools.
He said a recent U.S. Goverment Accounting Office study on the condition of schools placed Ohio at the bottom of the list.
"We're spending $14 per person on prisons and 80 cents per persons on schools," Cera said. "It's kind of backwards in my view."
Gov. George Voinovich had proposed a voter referendum on a $1 billion, 10-year state bonding plan for schools. However, the measure failed to win support of lawmakers earlier this year.
